channel.title: Array help
channel.description:
How would i use a .dat file instead of a array like
public String[] members = {4151, 5243,464t4,4t56543,};
and make it load in a dat file like
4151 5243 464t4 4t56543

item.title: Array help
item.dc:creator: @warlock_999 warlock 999
item.description:
@warlock_999 wrote:

how would i make it read the others ones like

1
2
3
4

Read full topic

item.title: Array help
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

You’re only reading from the file once and returning the first String that’s read…

Read full topic

item.title: Array help
item.dc:creator: @warlock_999 warlock 999
item.description:
@warlock_999 wrote:

Okay i got it working. But it’s only reading 1 word the others you can say. Any ideas?

http://www.warlock999.com/ClientSettings/BadWords.txt

Like it would only censor test but not the others

public String badWords() { String s = ""; try { URL url = new URL("http://www.warlock999.com/ClientSettings/BadWords.txt"); URLConnection urlconnection = url.openConnection(); BufferedReader bufferedreader = null; bufferedreader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(urlconnection.getInputStream())); s = bufferedreader.readLine(); bufferedreader.close(); } catch (Exception exception) { exception.printStackTrace(); } return s; }

Read full topic

item.title: Array help
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

BufferedWriter, and BufferedReader. Check them up on java.sun.com

Read full topic
